c-0: ^I'm an open book! Ask me anything you'd like.
c-1: ^What are your thoughts on the others in the archipelago?
^I get along pretty well with all of them. Is there anyone in particular you're wondering about?

c-0: ^What's your story? How did you come to live here?
^Ah, I don't have a very interesting story, I'm afraid! Nothing as exciting as yours.
^I've lived here my whole life, all 35 years, born and raised!
^So did my parents, and my grandparents, and so on.
^Actually, my workshop has been inherited for generations! Lots of mechanics in my family tree.
c-1: ^Do you ever want to leave this place?
^I'm not a very adventurous guy, and what I've heard about the outside world doesn't align with me at all.
^Plus, I have my workshop, all these interesting birds, a bunch of friends... I'm content staying here.
^I even get the occasional outsider looking for help, like you! That's enough excitement for me.

c-0: ^When I was a kid, I was super interested in how the lighthouse spotlight kept rotating...
^I nagged and nagged and nagged for my parents to take me there so I could check it out for myself, and they did!
^Sigrid seemed... not too pleased, at first. I thought she'd scold us, honestly.
^Even so, she showed me up to the top floor and let me look at that light. It was magical to me back then!
^Anyway, what I'm trying to get across here is that she might seem standoffish at times...
^But she's a good sort, and will help you out when you need it.
^I'd say we've become decent friends since then as well.
c-1: ^Irma came here not too long ago... well, it's been over a decade, but that's much shorter than anyone else here.
^After her sister disappeared, she was pretty closed off for a while.
^It was hard to really get to know her then.
^Fortunately, our jobs here wound up colliding every now and then.
^We had to work together on a few projects, and it gave me the opportunity to talk to her some more.
^She's quick-witted and smart! And passionate about her craft! I respect her a lot.

c-0: ^Ulrich is... pretty hard to understand at times.
^He's constantly congested! I can hardly hear him anytime I visit.
^Frankly, the first time I spoke with him, I thought he was mad at me! He sounded so gruff!
^Luckily he's a lot easier to understand when he takes his allergy medicine...
^Turns out he's a total sweetheart! I never would've guessed!
^He gave me some great tips on how to attract birds with different kinds of flowers...
^...and I do maintenance on his gardening tools from time to time. We get along amicably if I say so myself.
^So, uh, don't take it personally if he seems... off. Poor guy just needs a hit of his nasal spray.
c-1: ^Nobody cares more for the ecosystem here than Vera!
^I'm honestly a little lost on all that, myself.
^One time, I wanted to test out a mechanical doodad of mine in the water...
^...and she scolded me like no tomorrow!
^She said it was too loud and would scare away all the fish. I never even considered that!
^Oh, but I felt no ill will toward her whatsoever! She was right, after all.
^Anytime I want to take something like that into the water again, I double check with Vera first.
^She insists on not doing anything to disturb the waters here, and if there's anything I admire it's passion like that!
^I just hope she doesn't think of me as a threat to the ecosystem, ha ha... I'd hate to be her enemy.
